what: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: goal SSURGOPortal provide simple R interface ‘SSURGO Portal’ Python tools. Providing R wrapper around SSURGO Portal API allows users automate many operations might normally achieve graphical user interface.

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: can install development version {SSURGOPortal} like :

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: example shows install .PYZ file standard location: installation routine places SSURGO Portal file platform-specific folder: ssurgo_portal_dir("data") verify everything set working, can send "getstatus" command, like : See documentation ssurgo_portal() (?ssurgo_portal) available commands examples. general, command structured JSON specific request name various parameters. JSON string passed via terminal .pyz file Python interpreter. can inspect commands generated using command_only=TRUE example, sample "copytemplate" request create new GeoPackage database called "test.gpkg" template: Now inspecting command, can actually run :
code: library(SSURGOPortal) install_ssurgo_portal() ssurgo_portal("getstatus") #> $status #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $message #> [1] "It\"s alive! runmode=RunMode.DATA_LOADER, isPyz=True, __file__=C:\\Users\\Andrew.G.Brown\\AppData\\Roaming\\R\\data\\R\\SSURGOPortal\\SSURGOPortal.pyz\\dlcore\\dlutilities.py, currentPath=C:\\Users\\Andrew.G.Brown\\AppData\\Roaming\\R\\data\\R\\SSURGOPortal" #>  #> $elapsedseconds #> [1] 0 ssurgo_portal("copytemplate",                templatename = "GeoPackage",                folder = "sample_gpkg",                filename = "test",                overwrite = TRUE,                command_only = TRUE) #> [1] "cmd /c echo {\"request\":\"copytemplatefile\",\"templatename\":\"GeoPackage\",\"folder\":\"sample_gpkg\",\"filename\":\"test\",\"overwrite\":true} | \"C:\\PROGRA~1\\PYTHON~1\\python.exe\" \"C:\\Users\\Andrew.G.Brown\\AppData\\Roaming/R/data/R/SSURGOPortal/SSURGOPortal.pyz\" @" ssurgo_portal("copytemplate",                templatename = "GeoPackage",                folder = "sample_gpkg",                filename = "test",                overwrite = TRUE) #> $status #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $message #> [1] "Copied templates/geopackage.gpkg to sample_gpkg\\test.gpkg" #>  #> $elapsedseconds #> [1] 0

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: Using {soilDB} package SSURGO data input template databases can easily downloaded. example specify generic clause used sacatalog table Soil Data Access. instance wildcard returns single survey, "RI600", pattern used areas download multiple surveys within state (without explicitly knowing areasymbol). downloading extracting soil survey area data temporary directory, can “pretest” candidates import template. everything looks good, can go ahead import. use "importcandidates" request.
code: td <- file.path(tempdir(), "ssurgo_test")  download_ssurgo("areasymbol LIKE 'RI%'", exdir = td) ssurgo_portal(   "pretestimportcandidates",   database = "sample_gpkg/test.gpkg",   root = td,   istabularonly = FALSE ) ssurgo_portal(   "importcandidates",   database = "sample_gpkg/test.gpkg",   root = td,   istabularonly = FALSE,   skippretest = TRUE,   subfolders = c("RI600"),   loadinspatialorder = FALSE,   loadspatialdatawithinsubprocess = FALSE,   dissolvemupolygon = FALSE )

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: built routines binaries running tool Windows Python 3.9 3.10. using different version Python need sure required modules installed prior running ssurgo_portal().

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: prepare Python system virtual environment, run python -m pip install bottle gdal jsonschema (similar) make sure required modules already installed invoking SSURGO Portal tools.

title: Download and Interact with the SSURGO Portal Tools for Building and Editing U.S. Soil Survey Databases
text: package applies patches attempt make .PYZ contents minimally compatible Linux macOS. feature experimental intended provide feedback future development. patches included initialization routine triggered non-Windows platforms. routine installs bundled Windows wheel (.whl) files; expected fail platforms Python versions 3.9 3.10. encounter problems non-Windows platforms, file issue issue tracker.

what: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
title: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
text: Download ZIP files containing spatial (ESRI shapefile) tabular (TXT) files standard SSURGO format; optionally including corresponding SSURGO Template Database include_template=TRUE.

title: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
code: download_ssurgo(   WHERE = NULL,   areasymbols = NULL,   destdir = tempdir(),   exdir = destdir,   include_template = FALSE,   extract = TRUE,   remove_zip = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
text: SQL clause expression used filter records sacatalog table. Alternately can spatial object supported SDA_spatialQuery() defining target extent. areasymbols Character vector soil survey area symbols e.g. c("CA067", "CA077"). Used lieu argument. destdir Directory download ZIP files . Default tempdir(). exdir Directory extract ZIP archives . May directory yet exist. ZIP file extract folder labeled areasymbol directory. Default: destdir include_template Include (possibly state-specific) MS Access template database? Default: FALSE extract Logical. Extract ZIP files exdir? Default: TRUE remove_zip Logical. Remove ZIP files extracting? Default: FALSE overwrite Logical. Overwrite re-extracting directory already exists? Default: FALSE quiet Logical. Passed curl::curl_download().

title: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
text: Character. Paths downloaded ZIP files (invisibly). May exist remove_zip=TRUE.

title: Get SSURGO ZIP files from Web Soil Survey 'Download Soils Data' — download_ssurgo
text: specify Soil Survey Areas like obtain data use clause query sacatalog table areasymbol = 'CA067', "areasymbol ('CA628', 'CA067')"  areasymbol LIKE 'CT%'. Pipe-delimited TXT files found /tabular/ folder extracted SSURGO ZIP. files named tables SSURGO schema. header / files column names. See Soil Data Access Tables Columns Report: https://sdmdataaccess.nrcs.usda.gov/documents/TablesAndColumnsReport.pdf details tables, column names metadata including default sequence columns used TXT files. function returns try-error /areasymbols arguments result Several ESRI shapefiles found /spatial/ folder extracted SSURGO ZIP. prefix soilmu_ (mapunit), soilsa_ (survey area), soilsf_ (special features). also TXT file prefix soilsf_ describing special features. Shapefile names a_ (polygon), l_ (line), p_ (point) followed soil survey area symbol.

what: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal
title: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal
text: routine downloads latest .pyz file Web Soil Survey

title: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal
code: install_ssurgo_portal(   verbose = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   timeout = 3000,   src =     "https://websoilsurvey.sc.egov.usda.gov/DSD/Download/SsurgoPortal/SSURGO_Portal.zip",   ... )

title: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal
text: verbose Show download progress location file successful download? Default TRUE overwrite Overwrite existing .PYZ file? Default: FALSE timeout Default: 3000 seconds. Temporarily overrides options() timeout. src Default: "https://websoilsurvey.sc.egov.usda.gov/DSD/Download/SsurgoPortal/SSURGO_Portal.zip" ... Additional arguments download.file()

title: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal
text: Path downloaded file, try-error error.

title: Download SSURGO Portal .PYZ file from Web Soil Survey — install_ssurgo_portal

what: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
title: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
text: Generate commands 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader command-line interface, parse resulting JSON output.

title: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
code: ssurgo_portal(   request = NULL,   pyz_path = file.path(ssurgo_portal_dir("data"), "SSURGOPortal.pyz"),   ...,   schema = FALSE,   command_only = FALSE )

title: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
text: request One available request types, see Details. pyz_path Path "SSURGO Portal" .pyz file. Default "SSURGOPortal.pyz" ssurgo_portal_dir("data") directory. ... Additional parameters request schema Return request response schemas? Default: FALSE command_only Return command string rather executing ? Default: FALSE

title: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
text: list object corresponding JSON response. NULL (invisibly) error along standard output tool printed console.

title: Generate Requests for 'SSURGO Portal' Data Loader — ssurgo_portal
code: if (FALSE) { ssurgo_portal("getstatus")  ssurgo_portal("getstatus", schema = TRUE)  ssurgo_portal(   "getfoldertree",   path = "C:/SSURGO Portal/WV",   folderpattern = "WV",   filepattern = "txt",   ignorefoldercase = TRUE,   ignorefilecase = TRUE,   showfiles = FALSE,   maxdepth = 2 )  ssurgo_portal("gettemplatecatalog")  ssurgo_portal(   "copytemplate",   templatename = "GeoPackage",   folder = "test",   filename = "test.gpkg",   overwrite = TRUE )  dbp <- "C:/SSURGO Portal/Databases/West_Virginia_Geopackage.gpkg"  ssurgo_portal("opentemplate", database = dbp)  ssurgo_portal(   "pretestimportcandidates",   database = dbp,   root = "C:/SSURGO Portal/WV",   istabularonly = FALSE )  ssurgo_portal(   "importcandidates",   database = dbp,   root = "C:/SSURGO Portal/WV",   istabularonly = FALSE,   skippretest = TRUE,   subfolders = list("WV603"),   loadinspatialorder = FALSE,   loadspatialdatawithinsubprocess = TRUE,   dissolvemupolygon = TRUE )  ssurgo_portal("getdatabaseinventory", database = dbp)  ssurgo_portal("deleteareasymbols",               database = dbp,               areasymbols = list("WV603")) }

title: SSURGO Portal User Directories — ssurgo_portal_dir
text: standard locations storing data, config, cache information SSURGO Portal outside installation R package library.

title: SSURGO Portal User Directories — ssurgo_portal_dir
SSURGO Portal User Directories — ssurgo_portal_dir
text: One : "data", "config", "cache"

title: SSURGO Portal User Directories — ssurgo_portal_dir
text: character. Path data, config cache directories, respectively.

title: SSURGO Portal User Directories — ssurgo_portal_dir
code: ssurgo_portal_dir("data") #>                                       data  #> "/home/runner/.local/share/R/SSURGOPortal"  ssurgo_portal_dir("config") #>                                config  #> "/home/runner/.config/R/SSURGOPortal"  ssurgo_portal_dir("cache") #>                                cache  #> "/home/runner/.cache/R/SSURGOPortal"

title: SSURGOPortal 0.0.3
text: install_ssurgo_portal(): Updated Web Soil Survey source URL beta version SSURGO Portal .PYZ file https://websoilsurvey.sc.egov.usda.gov/DSD/Download/SsurgoPortal/SSURGO_Portal.zip

title: SSURGOPortal 0.0.2
text: install_ssurgo_portal() gains src argument specify URL source .PYZ install .PYZ files now automatically patched remove Python version limit Python versions 3.9 3.10 user responsible installing necessary dependencies: gdal, bottle, jsonschema. .e. python -m pip install gdal bottle jsonschema Note pre-compiled wheel files available Windows (https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/) can help encounter issues building gdal.

title: SSURGOPortal 0.0.1
text: Initial R package paired alpha release “SSURGO Portal” Added experimental patches use “SSURGO Portal” macOS Linux.
